elements.title: Fluence
elements.description: Fluence is the result of two industry powerhouses and pioneers in energy storage joining together to form a new company dedicated to innovating modern electric infrastructure. In January 2018, [Siemens](https://www.siemens.com/global/en/home/products/energy.html) and [AES](http://www.aes.com/home/default.aspx) launched Fluence. In Jan 2021 the Qatar Investment Authority is investing $125 million into them, [from TechCrunch](https://techcrunch.com/2020/12/30/fluence-the-energy-storage-systems-developer-is-now-worth-over-1-billion-after-qia-investment/)

elements.title: Modo Energy
elements.description: Stay on top of the energy storage market. Asset benchmarking, live data, market reports, and news. All in one place. founded and funded by ex kiwi power people

elements.title: Graphene battery breakthrough
elements.description: The startup [Nanotech Energy](https://nanotechenergy.com/) claims to be “the world’s top supplier of graphene” and plans to release a non-flammable, environmentally friendly lithium battery that can charge “18 times faster than anything that is currently available on the market” — within the next year.

elements.title: program on energy storage
elements.description: New York State Energy Research and Development Authority has a program on energy storage , their report sent by GridMarket when registering on their website
